revised_title: Kinetics and Properties of Muscle Haemoglobin
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the kinetics of muscle haemoglobin and its properties. They found that muscle haemoglobin has a hyperbolic dissociation curve and a faster rate of combination compared to blood haemoglobin. The study also showed that muscle haemoglobin satisfies the minimum postulates for a primitive respiratory pigment, making it an essential component in muscle function.
